Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Bull
Description: The limestone plaque represents a bull walking towards the right. The head has two solid horns, the body and the legs are finely carved. In the nape of the neck, the folds of the skin are indicated by parallel grooves. On the base of the plaque, one notices the border on which the animal is placed. There are no visible square lines.
